<<<<<<< HEAD
Land-lords law a treatise very fit for the perusal of all gentlemen and others : being a collection of several cases in the law concerning leases, distresses, replevins, rescous, waste, and several other matters which often happen between land-lord and tenant, as appears in the contents of the several chapters / by G. Meriton ... Meriton, George, 1634-1711.
[18], 171 p.
Printed for Henry Twyford, Thomas Dring, and John Place, London : 1665.
"An alphabetical table" [i.e. index]: prelim. p. [5]-[13]. Includes bibliographical references. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======

Printed for Henry Twyford, Thomas Dring, and John Place, London : 1665.
